ls-acid_blood.title: Acid Blood
ls-acid_blood.def: For each Fortitude Save the model fails against Melee Attacks, the model immediately inflicts 1 hit with Toxic Attacks against the model that caused the wound, before any casualties are removed, distributed onto the model's Health Pool.

ls-malodorous_swarm.title: Malodorous Swarm
ls-malodorous_swarm.def: The unit is never considered to have more than one Proper Rank.

ls-exalted_of_lust.title: Exalted of Lust
ls-exalted_of_lust.def: The model gains One of a Kind, +1 Health Point, Vanguard, and Aegis (+1, against Ranged Attacks).

ls-tightening_grasp.title: Tightening Grasp
ls-tightening_grasp.def: The model gains X, and can make as Supporting Attacks, ignoring the maximum number of Supporting Attacks. When the model is not Engaged in Combat, X is set to 1.At the start of each Round of Combat other than the First Round of Combat, if the model is Engaged, X is increased by +1 (e.g. 1 becomes 2).

ls-firestarter.title: Firestarter (X)
ls-firestarter.def: The Standard Bearer can cast the spell stated in brackets as a Bound Spell with Power Level (5/8).

ls-seeker_of_spite.title: Seeker of Spite
ls-seeker_of_spite.def: The number of chosen units for <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/objects_of_envy">Objects of Envy</nuxt-link> is increased by 1.

ls-exalted_of_envy.title: Exalted of Envy
ls-exalted_of_envy.def:
The model gains +1 Health Point. The model may perform Make Way moves even when it is in base contact with an enemy model.
The unit entry's Duplication Limit is changed to 0-2 Units/Army, and the General of an army with one or more models with Exalted of Envy must take Exalted of Envy.

ls-exalted_of_gluttony.title: Exalted of Gluttony
ls-exalted_of_gluttony.def: The model gains Maximized (Stomp Attacks), One of a Kind, and +1 Health Point.In addition, replace the rules of Devour with (changes from original version in bold):For each Health Point loss the model causes with Close Combat Attacks against enemy units, roll a D6 at the end of the Initiative Step. For each rolled 4+, the model gains +1 Health Point. When the model has 20 Health Points or more, all units within 12" immediately suffer 2D6 hits with Toxic Attacks, and the model is removed as a casualty.

ls-exalted_of_greed.title: Exalted of Greed
ls-exalted_of_greed.def: The model gains One of a Kind and +1 Health Point. In addition, all Weapon Enchantments are ignored for as long as their bearers remain in base contact with the model.

ls-exalted_of_pride.title: Exalted of Pride
ls-exalted_of_pride.def: The model gains One of a Kind and +1 Health Point. The rolls for determining the model's Attack Value and Offensive Skill are subject to Maximised Roll.

ls-exalted_of_sloth.title: Exalted of Sloth
ls-exalted_of_sloth.def: The model gains One of a Kind and +1 Health Point. In addition, instead of selecting spells, the model knows all spells from its chosen Path. A single Learned Spell may be exchanged for the Hereditary Spell during Spell Selection.

ls-horde_thresher.title: Horde Thresher
ls-horde_thresher.def:
Changes to the model's profile:
  • Its base size is changed to 100×100mm.
  • Its Health Points are set to 6.
  • It gains 1 additional Tiller.
  • It gains 1 additional Draft Beast.
  • It gains Colossal Stature.
  • The Chassis gains Impact Hits (3D3).

ls-legion_thresher.title: Legion Thresher
ls-legion_thresher.def:
Changes to the model's profile:
  • Its base size is changed to 100×150mm.
  • Its Health Points are set to 8.
  • It gains 2 additional Tillers.
  • It gains 2 additional Draft Beasts.
  • It gains Colossal Stature.
  • The Chassis gains Impact Hits (4D3).

ls-mountain_breaker.title: Mountain Breaker
ls-mountain_breaker.def: In the Charge Phase, the model gains Maximised (Charge Range) for Charges against units consisting entirely of models with Towering Presence. In addition, the model's Impact Hits gain Multiple Wounds (D3, against Towering Presence).

ls-exalted_of_wrath.title: Exalted of Wrath
ls-exalted_of_wrath.def: The model gains One of a Kind and +1 Health Point. In addition, whenever the model suffers one or more Health Point losses from a Close Combat Attack, it must reroll failed to hit rolls until the end of the Player Turn.

ls-morphlings.title: Morphlings
ls-morphlings.def:
- Universal RuleDuring Spell Selection, each unit of Veil Serpents must choose a Manifestation from the list below and apply the effects during the game.
• Lance of Lethargy (Champion only)
• Soporific Secretions
• Mirrored Scales

ls-greater_dominion_of_sin.title: Greater Dominion of Sin
ls-greater_dominion_of_sin.def: At the start of each friendly Player Turn, you may choose one friendly unit within the model's Commanding Presence range. All models in the chosen unit gain the model's <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/dominion">Dominion</nuxt-link> rule until the start of the next friendly Player Turn.

ls-dominion.title: Dominion
ls-dominion.def: Each Legion of Sin has its own Dominion rule that each Character must take, as specified in the corresponding unit entries.

ls-objects_of_envy.title: Objects of Envy
ls-objects_of_envy.def: Right before the battle (during step 7 of the Deployment Phase Sequence), you must choose a single unit from the opponent's Army List that is not from Core. The models of the chosen units are considered Objects of Envy.

ls-dominionofenvy.title: Dominion of Envy
ls-dominionofenvy.def: The model's unit must reroll natural to-hit rolls of ‘1’ against Objects of Envy.

ls-dominionofgluttony.title: Dominion of Gluttony
ls-dominionofgluttony.def:
The model's unit gains Frenzy. In addition,
the model's unit must reroll natural to-wound rolls of ‘1’ with its Melee Attacks, including Special Attacks.

ls-dominionofgreed.title: Dominion of Greed
ls-dominionofgreed.def: For every 3 Sin Tokens currently in the Sin Token pool, the model's unit gains +1 Defensive Skill.

ls-dominionoflust.title: Dominion of Lust
ls-dominionoflust.def: The model's unit gains Strider. In addition, the model's unit must reroll failed Charge Range rolls in the Charge Phase while located in the Charged unit's Flank or Rear Arc.

ls-dominionofpride.title: Dominion of Pride
ls-dominionofpride.def: The model's unit may reroll failed Discipline Tests.

ls-dominionofsloth.title: Dominion of Sloth
ls-dominionofsloth.def: In the Charge Phase, enemy units gain Minimised (Charge Range) for Charges against units with one or more models with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/dominion">Dominion</nuxt-link> of <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/sloth">Sloth</nuxt-link>.

ls-dominionofwrath.title: Dominion of Wrath
ls-dominionofwrath.def: The model's unit gains Devastating Charge (+1" Adv).

ls-lordly_levitator.title: Lordly Levitator
ls-lordly_levitator.def:
Dominant.
The model and each model in its unit gains Strider.

ls-sigils_of_supremacy.title: Sigils of Supremacy
ls-sigils_of_supremacy.def: The model gains +1 Health Point, up to a maximum of 3, and +1 Attack Value.

ls-trolls_blood.title: Troll's Blood
ls-trolls_blood.def:
Dominant.
The model and each model in its unit gains Fortitude (5+). For every natural roll of ‘6’ for a Fortitude Save from the model and each model in its unit, the model's Health Pool Raises one Health Point at the end of the phase.

ls-expanding_bulk.title: Expanding Bulk
ls-expanding_bulk.def:
The model loses Swiftstride and gains an effect depending on its Height:

  • Standard: Stomp Attacks (1)

  • Large: Stomp Attacks (2)

  • Gigantic: Grind Attacks (D3). Hits from these Grind Attacks that are distributed onto models with Towering Presence automatically fail to wound.

ls-unearthly_larynx.title: Unearthly Larynx
ls-unearthly_larynx.def:
Dominant.
The model and each model in its unit gains Distracting in the first Round of Combat, Elusive (see Sirens), and Feigned Flight.

ls-needle_teeth.title: Needle Teeth
ls-needle_teeth.def:
Dominant.
The model and each model in its unit gains Devastating Charge (+1 Att, +1 AP).

ls-covetous_camouflage.title: Covetous Camouflage
ls-covetous_camouflage.def: The model gains Ambush. At step 8 of the Pre-Game Sequence (after Spell Selection), each Character with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/covetous_camouflage">Covetous Camouflage</nuxt-link> may choose to gain Hidden instead. Additional models cannot be added to the unit during Army List creation.

ls-clutching_claws.title: Clutching Claws
ls-clutching_claws.def: When calculating Combat Score, a side with one or more models with this Manifestation Engaged in the Combat adds +X to its Combat Score. When the model is not Engaged in Combat, X is set to 0. At the start of each Round of Combat other than the First Round of Combat, if the model is Engaged, X is increased by 1. If there is more than one unit with this Manifestation Engaged in the same Combat, use the highest X value.

ls-coins_for_eyes.title: Coins for Eyes
ls-coins_for_eyes.def:
The model gains Stubborn while both the following conditions are met:

  • The model is in base contact with an enemy Scoring unit.

  • The model's unit does not have more ranks than files.

ls-chitinous_plates.title: Chitinous Plates
ls-chitinous_plates.def:
Dominant.
The model and each model in its unit gains +2 Armour, up to a maximum of 3.

ls-soporific_secretions.title: Soporific Secretions
ls-soporific_secretions.def: While Engaged in Combat, at the end of each Round of Combat, the model’s unit and all other units in base contact with one or more models with this Manifestation suffer -1 Strength and -1 Armour Penetration. The effects last until the end of the combat.

ls-lance_of_lethargy.title: Lance of Lethargy
ls-lance_of_lethargy.def: If the bearer is not a Wizard, it becomes a Wizard Apprentice that does not select spells as normal but instead always knows Spear of Infinity (Hereditary Spell). If the bearer is already a Wizard, it knows Spear of Infinity in addition to its other spells and cannot select it during Spell Selection. In addition, (Witchcraft) becomes the Attribute Spell for Spear of Infinity cast by the model. This instance of can only target the same unit as the Spell that triggered it.

ls-vorpal_blade.title: Vorpal Blade
ls-vorpal_blade.def:
Dominant.
Model parts without Harnessed of the model and of each model in its unit gain Lethal Strike.

ls-explosive_organs.title: Explosive Organs
ls-explosive_organs.def: When a  model with this Manifestation is removed as a casualty as a result of an enemy Melee Attack, it immediately inflicts 1 hit with Strength 3, Armour Penetration 1, and Magical Attacks against the model that caused the Health Point loss, before any casualties are removed, distributed onto the model’s Health Pool. Characters inflict 2D6 hits instead. This is considered a Special Attack.

ls-sledgehammer_hand.title: Sledgehammer Hand
ls-sledgehammer_hand.def:
Dominant.
The model and each model in its unit gains +1 Attack Value.

ls-legions_of_sin.title: Legions of Sin
ls-legions_of_sin.def:
For Army List creation, select one of the seven Legions of Sin. Only unit entries from the selected Legion of Sin may be used in the army. Note that some unit entries may have point costs, duplication limits, Manifestation options, mount options, etc. that differ from the Daemon Legions (DL) Army Book (see 8.D How to read unit entries for the different parts of the unit entries):


  • Each Legion of Sin has access to unique manifestations, whose rules can be found at the beginning of the corresponding chapter in this Supplement.
  • For all unit entries, apply the specifications in their headers in this Supplement Army Book.
  • For the unit profiles, i.e. the units' Characteristic Profiles and Model Rules, including any default and optional unit-specific Model Rules from the DL Army Book, please refer to the DL Army Book. For the Harbinger of each Legion of Sin, please refer to the Harbinger of Father Chaos unit entry.
  • The options given for each unit entry in this Supplement Army Book replace any options given for the corresponding unit entry in the DL Army Book.
  • The Harbinger of each Legion of Sin automatically gains a new Model Rule, and the other Characters gain new optional Model Rules. These Model Rules will be specified in the corresponding unit entry in this Supplement Army Book.
  • Characters cannot take Greater Dominion. Instead, the General must take Greater Dominion of Sin if available (see the Army Model Rules section and the corresponding unit entries).

ls-wages_of_sin.title: Wages of Sin
ls-wages_of_sin.def: During the enemy Siphon the Veil, the opponent may choose to gain up to 2 additional Veil Tokens.

ls-descent_into_sin.title: Descent into Sin
ls-descent_into_sin.def:
An army from this Supplement Army Book uses a Sin Token pool in order to track the Battlefield’s Descent into Sin. At the start of the game, this pool does not contain any Sin Tokens. During the game, specific events will add Sin Tokens to the pool.
Consult the Descent into Sin Table below to determine the effects of the current number of Sin Tokens in the pool. These effects come into play when both of the following conditions are met:


  • The corresponding threshold has been reached.

  • It is the Legion of Sin Player Turn.

In battles between two armies from this Supplement Army Book, track each pool separately.
from different thresholds and pools stack and, unless specifically stated otherwise, affect both armies.
\Add one Sin Token to your pool immediately when one of the following conditions is met:

  • The opponent chooses to apply Wages of Sin.
  • At the start of any Melee Phase, one or more friendly Characters with Dominion and/or Greater Dominion of Sin are in base contact with an enemy unit.

In addition, each Legion of Sin has a unique condition for adding Sin Tokens to their Sin Token pool:

  • Envy:
Add 1 Sin Token at the end of a phase in which one or more models with Dominion of Envy cause one or more Health Point losses against an Object of Envy; if one or more units containing Objects of Envy are removed as casualties, add 1 additional Sin Token.

  • Gluttony: Add 2 Sin Tokens at the end of any Melee Phase in which one or more units have been removed as casualties.
  • Greed: Add 1 Sin Token at the end of Siphon the Veil if the Active Player saved 3-5 Veil Tokens;
if 6 Veil Tokens were saved, add 2 Sin Tokens instead.
  • Lust: Add 1 Sin Token at the start of any Melee Phase for each unit that is Engaged with the Flank Facing of an enemy unit,
and 2 Sin Tokens for each unit that is Engaged with the Rear Facing of an enemy unit.
  • Pride: Add 1 Sin Token at the start of the Melee Phase for each combat in which one or more friendly single model units are Engaged with at least one enemy unit with more Full Ranks than themselves, up to a maximum of 2.

  • Sloth: Add 1 Sin Token at the end of any Magic Phase in which at least two non-Attribute Spells were successfully cast; in case of three or more, add 2 Sin Tokens instead.
  • Wrath: Add 1 Sin Token at the end of any Charge Phase in which two units declared a Charge;
if three or more units declared a Charge, add 2 Sin Tokens instead.

ls-pride.title: Pride
ls-pride.def: Courage Tests taken by units containing this Favour are Minimised. Command Tests taken by units containing this Favour are Maximised.

ls-gluttony.title: Gluttony
ls-gluttony.def: The first time a model with this Favour is on the winning side of a combat, its model parts with Path of the Favoured gain +1 Str with Duration: Permanent.

ls-envy.title: Envy
ls-envy.def: Charge Range and Pursue Distance rolls by units containing this Favour are Maximised.

ls-greed.title: Greed
ls-greed.def: The model part with Path of the Favoured gains Great Weapon, Halberd, Paired Weapons, and Weapon Master. A Chosen Lord with this Favour may take a second item from either the Artefacts category or the Potions and Scrolls category (but cannot take a second item from both categories).

ls-sloth.title: Sloth
ls-sloth.def: The model gains +1 Res. When the model's unit declares a Charge or performs a March Move, the effect is lost until the start of the Melee Phase in the next Player Turn.

ls-wrath.title: Wrath
ls-wrath.def: The model part with Path of the Favoured gains Fury, Frenzy, Unruly.

ls-aether_battery.title: Aether Battery
ls-aether_battery.def:
Aether Battery
NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Aeth. Battery318"3D641Before rolling for the number of shots, the owner may choose to discard 1--3 Veil Tokens from their Veil Token pool. If so, the number of shots is increased by +3 per discarded Veil Token.

ls-energy_bolts.title: Energy Bolts
ls-energy_bolts.def:
Energy Bolts - Shooting Weapon
NameAimRangeShotsStrAPAttack Attributes
Energy Bolts424"150-

np-iaijutsu.title: Iaijutsu
np-iaijutsu.def:
At step 5 of the Round of Combat Sequence (after issuing and accepting Duels), the model must use one of the following fighting techniques and apply its effects until the end of the Round of Combat.

  • Drawing the Void: Aegis (+1).
  • Ritual of Steel: +2 Armour Penetration with Close Combat Attacks.
  • A single Moment: +1 to wound with Close Combat Attacks.

np-duellist.title: Duellist
np-duellist.def: Unless another friendly Daimyo does so first, a Kensai must issue or accept Duels whenever possible.

np-fox_fire.title: Fox Fire
np-fox_fire.def: Enemy models in units in Base Contact with one or more Kitsune suffer -1 Offensive Skill, -1 Defensive Skill and -1 Agility.

np-blessings_of_the_kami.title: Blessings of the Kami
np-blessings_of_the_kami.def:
Friendly units in 8" gain Aegis (5+, against Ranged Attacks). \
Additionally, the model may cast Chorus of the Damned (Evocation) as a Bound Spell with Power Level (4/8).

np-war_shrine.title: War Shrine
np-war_shrine.def: The model gains War Platform, Exclusive (Scoring and Infantry), Attached, and changes its Base to 60mm. Additionally, models in the same unit as the War Shrine gain Lethal Strike and Fight in Extra Rank.

np-summoned_from_the_underworld.title: Summoned from the Underworld
np-summoned_from_the_underworld.def: The model cannot benefit from Commanding Presence or Rally Around the Flag.

np-scouting_party.title: Scouting Party
np-scouting_party.def: The model loses Devastating Charge (+1 Att) and Scoring, and gains Light Armour, Longbow (3+), Feigned Flight, Vanguard (12") and Light Troops.

np-fire_arrow.title: Fire Arrow
np-fire_arrow.def: Cannon. Range 48", Shots 1, Str 3 [7], AP 0 [10], Area Attack (1×5) [Multiple Wounds (D3)], Flaming Attacks.

np-firebomb.title: Firebomb
np-firebomb.def: Catapult (4×4), Range 12--48", Shots 1, Str 4, AP, Flaming Attacks. The model changes its Height to .

np-kyudo.title: Kyudo
np-kyudo.def:
The Shooting Attack gains Shots 2.\
Additionally, when shooting from Short Range, the attack gains +1 Armour Penetration.

np-prayers_of_the_kami.title: Prayers of the Kami
np-prayers_of_the_kami.def:
The model can cast the following Spells from Cosmology as Bound Spells with Power Level (4/8). These spells can only target the Yamabushi's unit or enemy units in base contact with the Yamabushi.

  • Hearts and Minds
  • Ice and Fire
  • Cosmic Scales

np-blessing_of_the_crescent_moon.title: Blessing of the Crescent Moon
np-blessing_of_the_crescent_moon.def: All models in a unit containing one or more models with this rule gain +1 Agility.

np-way_of_the_warrior.title: Way of the Warrior
np-way_of_the_warrior.def: Discipline Tests taken by the target are subject to Minimised Roll for the first Break Test

np-ritual_meditation.title: Ritual Meditation
np-ritual_meditation.def: Dispelling rolls from your opponent against Augment Spells suffer a -1 modifier if more than half of the models affected by the Spell have this rule. This also affects Bound Spells.

np-sashimonos.title: Sashimonos
np-sashimonos.def: Each side with one or more units with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/sashimonos">Sashimonos</nuxt-link> and at least one Full Rank adds +1 to its Combat Score.

np-katanamelee_weapon.title: KatanaMelee Weapon
np-katanamelee_weapon.def: Hand Weapon. Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Offensive Skill, +1 Strength and ignore Parry.

np-shurikenshooting_weapon.title: ShurikenShooting Weapon
np-shurikenshooting_weapon.def: Range 12", Shots: 2, Strength 3, Armour Penetration 0, Quick to Fire.

np-horo_cloakarmour_equipment.title: Horo CloakArmour Equipment
np-horo_cloakarmour_equipment.def: The bearer gains +1 Resilience against Ranged Attacks. This has no effect on Flaming Attacks or Toxic Attacks.

np-loner.title: Loner
np-loner.def: Kensai cannot join units that contain another Kensai. Unless another model does so first, a Kensai must issue a Duel.

np-hidden.title: Hidden
np-hidden.def:
The model isn’t deployed as normal. Instead, at the start of any Player Turn, the owner can choose a friendly unit containing Rank-and-File models, that satisfy the following:


  • The model with Hidden could have joined the unit.

  • The model with Hidden has an identical Base Size and Height as the Rank-and-File models in the unit.

  • The unit isn’t Shaken, and isn’t a Summoned unit.

After choosing an eligible unit, follow these steps:


  • Remove a Rank-and-File model with the same base size as the model with Hidden from the front rank from the chosen unit as a casualty.

  • Deploy the model with Hidden where the removed model was positioned.

np-exotic_poisons.title: Exotic Poisons
np-exotic_poisons.def: The model's Poison Attacks wound automatically on a successful to-hit roll of 5+ instead of 6+.

np-river_lord.title: River Lord
np-river_lord.def: If the model touches a Water Terrain feature at the beginning of any of its movements, it can choose to gain Fly (7", 14") until the end of the Phase.

np-hunters.title: Hunters
np-hunters.def: The model loses Scoring and gains Hard Target (1), Light Troops and Skirmisher.

np-continous_fire.title: Continous Fire
np-continous_fire.def: If this unit has at least two full ranks it can choose to use this rule in the Shooting Phase. If it does, only models in the first rank can shoot and any unit shot at by this unit must take a Courage Test with -1 for each Full Rank after the first of the shooting unit (to a maximum of -3). If this test is failed, the unit cannot perform a March Move in its next Player Turn. Units that automatically pass Panic Tests are unaffected by this rule.\

np-war_fan.title: War Fan
np-war_fan.def: The <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/war_fan">War Fan</nuxt-link> always counts as a Shield against Ranged Attacks (and can be used differently depending on the chosen Dance, see <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/kabuki_dance">Kabuki Dance)</nuxt-link>.

np-kabuki_dance.title: Kabuki Dance
np-kabuki_dance.def:
The model must choose one of the two dances to perform at step 2 of the Round of Combat Sequence and apply its effects until the end of the Round of Combat. All Kabuki Dolls in the unit must choose the same dance:

  • Jidaimono: +1 Armour Penetration. The War Fan counts as Paired Weapons with this dance.
  • Sewamono: Distracting. The War Fan counts as a Shield with this dance.

np-set_ablaze.title: Set Ablaze
np-set_ablaze.def: Before shooting, the model may choose to gain Flaming Attacks for its Shooting Attack. The effect lasts for the duration of the phase.

np-attached.title: Attached
np-attached.def: This model must be deployed inside a unit containing Rank-and-File models, and it cannot voluntarily leave its unit.

np-mon_of_the_ashiwara_clan.title: Mon of the Ashiwara Clan
np-mon_of_the_ashiwara_clan.def: Models with this Mon gain Quick to Fire and Shoot in Extra Rank.Longbow of a Daimyo with this Mon gains Shots 3.

np-mon_of_the_daimatsu_clan.title: Mon of the Daimatsu Clan
np-mon_of_the_daimatsu_clan.def:
Infantry only.

Models with this Mon gain Distracting in the first Round of each Combat.

np-mon_of_the_horumi_clan.title: Mon of the Horumi Clan
np-mon_of_the_horumi_clan.def: Warrior Monks and Yamabushi with this Mon gain Aegis (5+, against Melee Attacks).Yamabushi, Shugenja and Mikoshi Shrine with this Mon generates a Veil Token at the beginning of the game and allows storing an additional Veil Token at the end of Siphon the Veil (up to a maximum of 6 Veil Tokens).\Divination=divination

np-extra_support.title: Extra Support
np-extra_support.def: The model part replaces the limit on the maximum number of Attacks that can be done as Restricted Attacks with the value in brackets (X), or if it includes a +, increases the limit with +X.

np-mon_of_the_shinsei_clan.title: Mon of the Shinsei Clan
np-mon_of_the_shinsei_clan.def: Models with this Mon may re-roll failed Ambush rolls, and gain Hatred and Vanguard.

np-mon_of_the_taneka_clan.title: Mon of the Taneka Clan
np-mon_of_the_taneka_clan.def:
Cannot be taken by Infantry models.

Model parts with this Mon and with Kenjutsu (X) gain Devastating Charge (Kenjutsu (2)). Additionally, Units with all of their models with this Mon must reroll any natural rolls of ‘1’
when rolling for Charge Range.

np-kenjutsu.title: Kenjutsu (X)
np-kenjutsu.def: For every X successful to-hit rolls against the same Health Pool, an additional hit is caused. Count seperately for each Character and each Initiative Step. While fighting in a Duel, the model part decreases the value of X by 1 until the Duel ends (i.e. a Model with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/kenjutsu">Kenjutsu</nuxt-link> (3) effectively has <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/kenjutsu">Kenjutsu</nuxt-link> (2) while fighting in a Duel). If a model has multiple instances of <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/kenjutsu">Kenjutsu</nuxt-link> (X), use the one with the lowest value for X.

np-katana.title: Katana
np-katana.def: Hand Weapon. Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Offensive Skill, +1 Strength and ignore Parry.

np-shuriken.title: Shuriken
np-shuriken.def: Range 12", Shots: 2, Strength 3, Armour Penetration 0, Quick to Fire.

np-horo_cloak.title: Horo Cloak
np-horo_cloak.def: The bearer gains +1 Resilience against Ranged Attacks. This has no effect on Flaming Attacks or Toxic Attacks.

np-call_of_the_war_god.title: Call of the War God
np-call_of_the_war_god.def: This spell may only target Characters, Champions, and single model units. Choose two different combinations of Model Part and non-global characteristic (except Armour). Choose these characteristics prior to making a Casting Attempt. Each chosen model part gets +1 to the chosen characteristic. {Your opponent cannot refuse Duels issued by the target.}

np-curse_of_the_wind_god.title: Curse of the Wind God
np-curse_of_the_wind_god.def:
The wielder always shoots before all other models in his unit. For every successful to-hit roll of attacks with this weapon, choose one of the following Attack Attributes (Shooting), which apply to all other friendly models making Shooting Attacks with a Longbow against the target unit in this phase:

  • Natural to-hit rolls of ‘1’ must be rerolled.
  • Natural to-wound rolls of ‘1’ must be rerolled.
  • The Armour Penetration of the attack is set to 1.

np-dragon_claw.title: Dragon Claw
np-dragon_claw.def: Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Strength, +2 Armour Penetration and Lightning Reflexes.

np-dance_of_the_cherry_blossoms.title: Dance of the Cherry Blossoms
np-dance_of_the_cherry_blossoms.def: Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Armour Penetration. Additionally, the bearer gains Kenjutsu (2).

np-black_demon_essence.title: Black Demon Essence
np-black_demon_essence.def: Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration. If the wielder causes one or more unsaved wounds with this weapon while charging, all models in the target unit suffer -1 to-hit until the end of the Round of Combat.

np-symbol_of_imperial_rule.title: Symbol of Imperial Rule
np-symbol_of_imperial_rule.def: The wearer gains +1 Armour. Melee Attacks can never wound the bearer on better than 4+.

np-mempo_of_blood.title: Mempo of Blood
np-mempo_of_blood.def: The bearer gains Fear and enemy units cannot choose Stand and Shoot as a Charge Reaction when reacting to Charges made by the bearer’s unit.

np-nobunagas_honour.title: Nobunaga's Honour
np-nobunagas_honour.def: The wearer gains +1 Armour. In addition, the wearer can always make an Armour Save against enemy attacks; his Armour Save succeeds at least on a roll of 5+ (independent of the Armour Penetration of the Attack).

np-mirumotos_battle_standard.title: Mirumoto's Battle Standard
np-mirumotos_battle_standard.def:
Models in the bearer's unit gain Lightning Reflexes in
the First Round of Combat. Model Parts with Harnessed are not affected.

np-generals_kabuto.title: General's Kabuto
np-generals_kabuto.def: One use only. Must be activated when the bearer's model suffers its first wound in the game after Armour Saves. The bearer’s model gains Aegis (2+) against this wound.

np-dragon_pearl.title: Dragon Pearl
np-dragon_pearl.def: A single Casting Attempt with 3 or more Magic Dice performed by the bearer can be subject to Maximised Role in each Magic Phase. Declare using this item before rolling any dice.

np-candle_of_the_void.title: Candle of the Void
np-candle_of_the_void.def: One use only. This item can be used at the beginning of any phase and lasts until the end of the Player Turn. The bearer's unit gains +4 " March Rate, Swiftstride, Ghost Step and Strider. No models can join or leave the unit until the effect ends.

np-rod_of_the_horizons.title: Rod of the Horizons
np-rod_of_the_horizons.def: Directly after choosing Spells, the bearer selects one of his own Spells. All Casting Attempts of this Spell with 2 or more Dice performed by the bearer are subject to Maximised Role.

np-mempo_of_honour.title: Mempo of Honour
np-mempo_of_honour.def: Duels issued by the model must (if possible) be accepted by an enemy Character, unless a Champion accepts first. The bearer’s model can score up to +4 Overkill Combat Score instead of +3.

np-prayer_beads_of_the_inner_fire.title: Prayer Beads of the Inner Fire
np-prayer_beads_of_the_inner_fire.def: All models in the bearer's unit gain Ritual Meditation.

np-bronze_token.title: Bronze Token
np-bronze_token.def: All enemy model parts gain -1 Attack Value while fighting in a Duel with the bearer.

np-sahimonos.title: Sashimonos
np-sahimonos.def: Each side with one or more units with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/sashimonos">Sashimonos</nuxt-link> and at least one Full Rank adds +1 to its Combat Score.

er-giant_see_giant_do.title: Giant See, Giant Do
er-giant_see_giant_do.def: - Universal RuleThe model gains Cult of Errahman and Fortitude (6+).

er-big_brother.title: Big Brother
er-big_brother.def: The model's Health Points are set to 8, and its base size is changed to 75×100 mm. The model gains Maximised (Stomp Attacks).

er-giant_club.title: Giant Club
er-giant_club.def: Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration.

er-rabid_spasms.title: Rabid Spasms
er-rabid_spasms.def: Whenever the model would inflict 1 Toxic Attacks hit from Cult of Errahman, it inflicts 2 hits instead.

er-virulent_fumes.title: Virulent Fumes
er-virulent_fumes.def: Infantry models in friendly units within 6" of the model gain Fortitude (+1, max. 4+).

er-bubonic_brew.title: Bubonic Brew
er-bubonic_brew.def: Catapult (6×6). Range 12--60", Shots 1, Str 1, AP 10. Units that suffer one or more Health Point losses from a Shooting Attack made with this weapon count as having the Sacred Plague Dread Rot successfully cast on them.

er-the_end_is_nigh.title: The End is Nigh
er-the_end_is_nigh.def: The model gains Fearless, Frenzy, Hard Target (1), Light Troops, Skirmisher, and loses Scoring.

er-apostle_of_plague.title: Apostle of Plague
er-apostle_of_plague.def: While within 12" of the model, friendly units gain Minimised (Discipline Tests).

er-pestilent_pulpit.title: Pestilent Pulpit
er-pestilent_pulpit.def: The model knows one additional Learned Spell, and the model’s unit gains Fearless and Poison Attacks. If the models already had Poison Attacks, then they wound automatically on a successful natural to-hit roll of ‘5’ or ‘6’, unless the target has Immune (Poison Attacks).

er-holy_triumvirate.title: Holy Triumvirate
er-holy_triumvirate.def:
If there are at least 3 models with Holy Triumvirate on your Army List, these models can all select spells as follows:
  • Wizard Apprentices: select from the Learned Spells 1, 2, 3, and 4 of their chosen Path.
  • Wizard Adepts: select from the Learned Spells 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 of their chosen Path.
  • During Spell Selection, each Wizard can choose to select one Learned Spell fewer than usual and to select 1 Sacred Plague instead.

er-sling.title: Sling
er-sling.def: The attack gains +1 Strength when shooting from Short Range.

er-insurgents.title: Insurgents
er-insurgents.def: The model gains Hard Target (1), Light Troops, Skirmisher, and loses Scoring.

er-sacred_plagues.title: Sacred Plagues
er-sacred_plagues.def:
Sacred Plagues are upgrades that certain Cult of Errahman Characters and Champions may take. Sacred Plagues are Bound Spells with Power Level (4/8) and Duration: Permanent.
Certain Champions may choose 1 Sacred Plague from the list below that must be noted on the Army List and that has Range 8". Certain Characters may choose up to 4 different Sacred Plagues that they select from the list below during Spell Selection and that have Range 18".
Instead of measuring a Sacred Plague's Range from the Caster as normal, it can be measured from any unit under the effect of a Sacred Plague within 18" of the Caster. If so, the Range is set to 8".
Slug PoxHexThe target suffers -2 Agility and -2" Charge Rate. TrollscaleAugmentThe target gains Fear and +1 Resilience. Gnashing FeverUniversalThe target gains Fury, Fearless, and Frenzy. Dread RotUniversalAt the start of each Magic Phase, the target suffers 2D6 hits with Strength 2, Armour Penetration 1, and Lethal Strike.An army cannot attempt to cast the same Sacred Plague more than twice during the same Magic Phase. Only one Sacred Plague can affect a unit at a time (the one most recently successfully cast).
At the end of step 3 of any Magic Phase Sequence (after Siphon the Veil), the opponent may remove one or more dice from their Magic Dice Pool. For each removed Magic Dice, the opponent nominates a unit (friend or foe) under the effect of a Sacred Plague. The Sacred Plague affecting the nominated unit immediately ends.

er-slug_pox.title: Slug Pox
er-slug_pox.def: The target suffers -2 Agility and  -2" Charge Rate.

er-trollscale.title: Trollscale
er-trollscale.def: The target gains Fear and +1 Resilience.

er-gnashing_fever.title: Gnashing Fever
er-gnashing_fever.def: The target gains Fury, Fearless, and Frenzy.

er-dread_rot.title: Dread Rot
er-dread_rot.def: At the start of each Magic Phase, the target suffers 2D6 hits with Strength 2, Armour Penetration 1, and Lethal Strike.

er-callous.title: Callous
er-callous.def:
Health Point losses of the model that are caused by friendly models are ignored for Panic (including units destroyed due to attacks from friendly models). The model may use Shooting Attacks against enemy units Engaged in Combat, with the following rules and restrictions:
  • Friendly units Engaged in this Combat are ignored for Cover purposes (but not for drawing Line of Sight).
  • Roll to hit as normal against the intended target. Immediately after determining the number of hits, roll a D6 for each hit. On a roll of 4+, the hit is distributed onto a randomly chosen friendly unit Engaged with the original target. Otherwise, proceed as normal.

er-fear_no_evil.title: Fear no Evil
er-fear_no_evil.def: While the model's unit is Steadfast and does not suffer from Disrupted Ranks, it gains Fearless and Unbreakable. In addition, while joined by one or more Characters with Cult of Errahman, Charge, Pursuit, and Overrun Moves of the model's unit gain Swiftstride.

er-life_is_cheap.title: Life is Cheap
er-life_is_cheap.def: When calculating Combat Score, halve the first 10 Health Point losses of models with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/life_is_cheap">Life is Cheap</nuxt-link> per unit, rounding fractions up. This does not affect Combat Score bonuses from Overkill.

er-martyrdom.title: Martyrdom
er-martyrdom.def: When a friendly model with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/martyrdom">Martyrdom</nuxt-link> is removed as a casualty, place a marker for each of the model's initial Health Points in a Martyr Pool. At the start of any friendly Siphon the Veil, you may remove 10 or more markers from your Martyr Pool and gain 1 Veil Token for every 10 removed markers, up to a maximum of 3 Veil Tokens per Magic Phase.

er-cult_of_errahman.title: Cult of Errahman
er-cult_of_errahman.def:
Whenever a natural ‘1’ is rolled to hit for an enemy Close Combat Attack allocated towards a model with Cult of Errahman, the model part inflicts 1 hit with Toxic Attacks on the attacking model's unit in the same Initiative Step, before any casualties are removed.
models with Cult of Errahman cannot be joined by models without Cult of Errahman.

er-plague_flail.title: Plague Flail
er-plague_flail.def: Halberd. The wielder gains Devastating Charge (Lethal Strike). In addition, the wielder and enemy units in base contact with one or more models using a Plague Flail suffer -1 Defensive Skill.

er-bloodpox_blades.title: Bloodpox Blades
er-bloodpox_blades.def: Paired Weapons. Attacks made with Bloodpox Blades become Poison Attacks.

er-toxic_incense.title: Toxic Incense
er-toxic_incense.def: While using this weapon, the wielder gains D3 that are resolved with Toxic Attacks at Initiative Step 10.

er-pestilential_wrath.title: Pestilential Wrath
er-pestilential_wrath.def: Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Armour Penetration. In addition, attacks with a natural to-hit roll of ‘6’ made with this weapon become Divine Attacks and gain Multiple Wounds (D3).

er-eye_of_errahman.title: Eye of Errahman
er-eye_of_errahman.def: The bearer and models in the bearer's unit gain Fury. In addition, for each natural to-hit roll of ‘1’ with a Close Combat Attack made by the bearer's unit, the bearer's unit suffers 1 hit with Strength 3 and Armour Penetration 0 in the same Initiative Step. This is considered a Special Attack.

er-martyrs_shroud.title: Martyr's Shroud
er-martyrs_shroud.def: models with Cult of Errahman in the bearer's unit gain Fortitude (6+).

er-plague_prophets_blessing.title: Plague Prophet's Blessing
er-plague_prophets_blessing.def: The wearer gains +1 Health Point and Fortitude (5+). Successful to-hit rolls with Close Combat Attacks against the wearer must be rerolled.

er-orators_toga.title: Orator’s Toga
er-orators_toga.def: The bearer gains Stand Behind and cannot issue Duels.

er-putrid_pamphlet.title: Putrid Pamphlet
er-putrid_pamphlet.def: The bearer’s unit must reroll natural to-hit rolls of ‘1’.

er-crucible_of_contagion.title: Crucible of Contagion
er-crucible_of_contagion.def: The bearer’s model gains +1 Health Point, and enemy units in base contact with the bearer’s model suffer -1 Resilience.

er-plague_disciples.title: Plague Disciples
er-plague_disciples.def: The unit replaces its Bloodpox Blades with Plague Flail.

er-underworld_beast.title: Underworld Beast
er-underworld_beast.def: The model gains Random Movement (3D6") and its Attack Value is set to 4D3. It loses the Pitmaster model part, and its base size is changed to 60×100 mm.

df-omen_of_the_dread_fleet.title: Omen of the Dread Fleet
df-omen_of_the_dread_fleet.def: After determining Deployment Zones (at the end of step 6 of the Pre-Game Sequence), you may choose a single Field, Ruins, or Forest Terrain Feature that becomes Water Terrain. In addition, while the model is on the Battlefield, all Water Terrain Features on the Battlefield are considered Dangerous Terrain (1) for all models.

df-toxic_scum.title: Toxic Scum
df-toxic_scum.def: At Initiative Step 10, all other units (friend and foe) Engaged in the same Combat as the model suffer D6+1 hits with Toxic Attacks.

df-corsair_boarders.title: Corsair Boarders
df-corsair_boarders.def: The model gains Heavy Armour and Scoring.

df-corsair_ravagers.title: Corsair Ravagers
df-corsair_ravagers.def: The model gains Extra Support (2), Hard Target (1), Light Troops and Skirmisher. In addition, enemy models that are not immune to the effects of Fear in units in base contact with one or more models with Corsair Ravagers suffer -1 Courage.

df-obsidian_admiral.title: Obsidian Admiral
df-obsidian_admiral.def: The model part gains +2 Attack Value and its Special Item allowance is increased by 100 pts. In addition, the army may modify the roll for choosing Deployment Zones by -1.

df-colossal_kraken.title: Colossal Kraken
df-colossal_kraken.def: The model gains +2 Health Points, 2 additional Lashmasters, and its base size is changed to 100×150 mm.

df-professional_courtesy.title: Professional Courtesy
df-professional_courtesy.def: The model cannot join units that contain another model from the same unit entry.

df-artistry_of_death.title: Artistry of Death
df-artistry_of_death.def: The attack gains +1 to wound. Attacks with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/artistry_of_death">Artistry of Death</nuxt-link> lose <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/ruthless_efficiency">Ruthless Efficiency</nuxt-link> if they had it.

df-captains_orders.title: Captain's Orders
df-captains_orders.def:
At step 8 of the Pre-Game Sequence (after Spell Selection), the owner must choose one of the following options and apply its effect to all models with Captain's Orders in the army:

  • Give no Quarter: The model gains Scoring.

  • Loot and Pillage: The model gains Light Troops.

df-mist_weaver.title: Mist Weaver
df-mist_weaver.def: The model’s unit gains Coastal Predator and Devastating Charge (Lethal Strike).

df-storm_singer.title: Storm Singer
df-storm_singer.def: The model can select its spells from all the Learned Spells of its chosen Path and the Hereditary Spell. This rule overrides the Spell Selection rules connected to being a Wizard Adept.

df-advancing_gloom.title: Advancing Gloom
df-advancing_gloom.def: Enemy units within 8" of one or more Sea-Fog Leviathans suffer -1 to hit for Shooting Attacks. In addition, the duration of <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/shrouded_by_mist">Shrouded by Mist</nuxt-link> is extended until the end of the second Game Turn.

df-sirens_song.title: Siren's Song
df-sirens_song.def: Combat Reform Tests and March Tests of enemy units within 8" of one or more models with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/sirens_song">Siren's Song</nuxt-link> suffer -2 Courage.

df-irresistible_will.title: Irresistible Will
df-irresistible_will.def: Dispelling rolls against spells cast by the model suffer a -2 Dispelling Modifier if the Casting Attempt was performed with 4 or more Magic Dice.

df-mistrusted.title: Mistrusted
df-mistrusted.def: If the model is the General, Courage Tests using its Commanding Presence suffer -1 Courage.

df-coastal_predator.title: Coastal Predator
df-coastal_predator.def:
The model gains Strider (Water Terrain). In addition, units gain Devastating Charge (+2" Cha) and Hard Target (1) while both the following conditions are met:

  • More than half of their models have Coastal Predator.

  • More than half of their models have the centre of their base inside a Water Terrain Feature.


Characters without Coastal Predator that Charge out of a unit do not benefit from Coastal Predator.

df-terrors_of_the_deep.title: Terrors of the Deep
df-terrors_of_the_deep.def: The number of models with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/terrors_of_the_deep">Terrors of the Deep</nuxt-link> in the army is restricted to 1 per 1500 Army Points, rounding fractions up.

df-barbed_nets.title: Barbed Nets
df-barbed_nets.def: At the start of each Round of Combat that the model’s unit is fighting, each unit with one or more models with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/barbed_nets">Barbed Nets</nuxt-link> must choose one enemy unit in base contact and roll a D6. On 2+, the chosen unit is Netted. Units Netted one or more times suffer -1 Strength and -1 Armour Penetration until the end of the Round of Combat.

df-ruthless_efficiency.title: Ruthless Efficiency
df-ruthless_efficiency.def: The attack gains +1 to wound during the First Round of Combat.

df-shrouded_by_mist.title: Shrouded by Mist
df-shrouded_by_mist.def:
Apply the following rules during the first Game Turn:


  • For Shooting Attacks made against units that are more than 12" away, all units (friend and foe) are considered to be in Soft Cover.

  • Charge Range rolls made against units that are more than 12" away are subject to Minimised Roll unless more than half of the Charging unit’s models have Coastal Predator.

df-tempest_of_the_storm_witch.title: Tempest of the Storm Witch
df-tempest_of_the_storm_witch.def: The target may immediately perform a 12" Magical Move and loses Scoring. {In addition, the target gains Coastal Predator.}

df-lacerating_touch.title: Lacerating Touch
df-lacerating_touch.def: Attacks made with this weapon gain +2 Armour Penetration. While using this weapon, the wielder gains +2 Attack Value and Fear.

df-hurricanes_fury.title: Hurricane's Fury
df-hurricanes_fury.def: Range 18", Shots 2D6. Shooting Attacks of units that are hit by one or more attacks made with this weapon suffer -1 to hit until the end of the next Player Turn.

df-veil_of_harag.title: Veil of Harag
df-veil_of_harag.def: The bearer can cast Tempest of the Storm Witch (Hereditary Spell) as a Bound Spell with Power Level (4/8).

df-storm_cloak.title: Storm Cloak
df-storm_cloak.def: The bearer gains Magic Resistance (2) and Hard Target (1).

df-chest_of_enveloping_fog.title: Chest of Enveloping Fog
df-chest_of_enveloping_fog.def: One use only. The owner may activate this Artefact at the end of any friendly Movement Phase and place a Water Terrain Feature in contact with the bearer and at least 1" away from any enemy units and other Terrain Features. The Water Terrain must fit within a circle with a diameter of 6".

df-black_flag.title: Black Flag
df-black_flag.def: The bearer's unit gains Fear, and while in base contact with the bearer's unit, enemy units gain Maximised (Fear Tests). In addition, friendly units Engaged in the same Combat as the bearer's unit must reroll natural to-wound rolls of '1'.

df-banner_of_tides.title: Banner of Tides
df-banner_of_tides.def: The bearer’s unit gains Feigned Flight.

giants-giant_club.title: Giant Club
giants-giant_club.def: Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration.

giants-big_brother.title: Big Brother
giants-big_brother.def: The model's Health Points are set to 8, and its base size is changed to 75×100 mm. The roll for the number of hits from its Stomp Attacks is subject to Maximised Roll.

giants-uprooted_tree.title: Uprooted Tree
giants-uprooted_tree.def: Attacks made with this weapon hit automatically and have their Strength set to 5 and their Armour Penetration set to 0.

giants-beer_barrel.title: Beer Barrel
giants-beer_barrel.def:
The bearer gains Looted Booze. Once per game, the weapon may be used as a Shooting Weapon with the following profile:
Range 8", Shots 1, Str 4, AP 0, Area Attack (3×3), Reload!, hits automatically. After being used as a Shooting Weapon, the bearer loses Looted Booze.

giants-fame.title: Fame
giants-fame.def:
The Beast Giant model part gains Harnessed and the model gains an additional model part:

Friendly units within 6" of one or more models with Fame gain a +2 Discipline modifier for Discipline Tests for Primal Instinct. The model's range of Fame is increased to:
  • 9" the first time an enemy Large Height model is removed as a casualty due to the model's attacks.
  • 12" the first time an enemy Gigantic Height model is removed as a casualty due to the model's attacks.

giants-primal_instinct.title: Primal Instinct
giants-primal_instinct.def: During Choose Equipment and Abilities, each unit containing this Attack Attribute must take a Command test. If the test is passed, all model parts with Primal Instinct in the unit gain Hatred during this Round of Combat.

giants-mark_of_the_eternal_champion.title: Mark of the Eternal Champion
giants-mark_of_the_eternal_champion.def: If the bearer is not a Wizard, it becomes a Wizard Apprentice that does not select spells as normal but always knows Spear of Infinity (Hereditary Spell). If the bearer is already a Wizard, it knows Spear of Infinity in addition to its other spells and cannot select it during Spell Selection.

giants-sorcerous_antennae.title: Sorcerous Antennae
giants-sorcerous_antennae.def: At the start of Siphon the Veil in each of your Magic Phases, choose a single model part in each unit with one or more instances of this Manifestation. The chosen model part gains Channel (1) until the end of the Magic Phase.

giants-unnatural_roots.title: Unnatural Roots
giants-unnatural_roots.def: A side with one or more models with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/unnatural_roots">Unnatural Roots</nuxt-link> Engaged in Combat when Combat Scores are calculated adds +1 to its Combat Score.

giants-monstrous_whip.title: Monstrous Whip
giants-monstrous_whip.def: Rolls for Charge Range of other friendly Gigantic models that are within 12" of one or more models with <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/monstrous_whip">Monstrous Whip</nuxt-link> are subject to Maximised Roll.

giants-dread_mask.title: Dread Mask
giants-dread_mask.def: The model gains Devastating Charge (Distracting) and can cast Illusory Paths (Witchcraft) as a Bound Spell with Power Level (4/8). In addition, Fear Tests caused by the model and rolls for Flee Distance of enemy units that Break from Combat while in base contact with the model are subject to Maximised Roll.

giants-giant_seeker.title: Giant Seeker
giants-giant_seeker.def: The model gains Aegis (6+), Fearless, The bigger they are, Unbreakable, Yer comin' with me!, and loses Shield.

giants-giant_of_the_deep.title: Giant of the Deep
giants-giant_of_the_deep.def: The model gains Shield Wall and Light Armour.

giants-big_fan_of_sunna.title: Big Fan of Sunna
giants-big_fan_of_sunna.def: The model gains Fury, Fearless, and Fanatical (see Flagellants unit).

giants-lion_cloak_and_axe.title: Lion Cloak and Axe
giants-lion_cloak_and_axe.def: The model replaces its Light Armour with Lion's Fur and gains Multiple Wounds (2, against Large and Beasts, Large and Cavalry, Gigantic).

giants-infernal_armour.title: Infernal Armour
giants-infernal_armour.def: Plate Armour. The wearer gains Aegis (5+, against Flaming Attacks).

giants-tower_shield.title: Tower Shield
giants-tower_shield.def: The model gains Soft Cover against attacks from models Located in its Front Arc, and Parry.

giants-infernal_lash.title: Infernal Lash
giants-infernal_lash.def: The model gains +2 Agility. At the start of each Melee Phase, you may choose a single friendly unit within 6" of the wielder (including the wielder itself). The chosen unit's Close Combat Attacks become Flaming Attacks and Magical Attacks until the end of the Melee Phase.

giants-oil_kegs.title: Oil Kegs
giants-oil_kegs.def: The model loses Infernal Brand and Infernal Armour and gains Light Armour, Oil Flasks, Flammable, Insignificant, and Throwing Weapons (4+) with Shots 4.

giants-serf_helper.title: Serf Helper
giants-serf_helper.def: The model gains Honesty and Orison (0), and loses Ordeal and Shield.

giants-knighted_giant.title: Knighted Giant
giants-knighted_giant.def: The model gains Devastating Charge (+3 Str, +3 AP), , Light Armour, and Courage, and loses Ordeal and Shield.

giants-iron_fist.title: Iron Fist
giants-iron_fist.def:
This weapon cannot be enchanted with Weapon Enchantments from the List of Common or Shared Magic Items.
+1 Arm, +1 Att, and Parry.

giants-troll_stew_cauldron.title: Troll Stew Cauldron
giants-troll_stew_cauldron.def: The model gains Breath Attack (Str 3, AP 1) and Fortitude (5+). If the model has used this Breath Attack, it regains Breath Attack (Str 3, AP 1) at the end of a Melee Phase during which the bearer caused at least four Health Point losses against enemy units with Close Combat Attacks and Stomp Attacks.

giants-wrecking_ball.title: Wrecking Ball
giants-wrecking_ball.def: The wielder gains Fearless, Random Movement (3D6"), Shambolic, and Grind Attack (D6+X), where X is equal to the Attack Value modifier the model gains from Rage. The wielder cannot perform any Close Combat Attacks.

giants-belly_flop.title: Belly Flop
giants-belly_flop.def:
When declaring a Charge, the model may declare to perform a Belly Flop in the First Round of Combat. If so, this Special Attack must be made against the Charged unit at the model's Agility.
  • The Charged unit suffers 1 hit with Str 5, AP 2, and Area Attack (3×4).
  • The model's Defensive Skill is set to 1, it cannot perform any other Special Attacks nor Close Combat Attacks, and it becomes Shaken.
The effects last until the end of the Round of Combat.

giants-pet_salamander.title: Pet Salamander
giants-pet_salamander.def: Whenever a Misfire is rolled, instead of rolling on the Misfire Table, the model suffers D3 hits that wound automatically with no saves of any kind allowed.

giants-skink_companion.title: Skink Companion
giants-skink_companion.def: The Saurian Giant model part gains Poison Attacks. The model gains the following additional model parts:

giants-bone_break_dancer.title: Bone Break Dancer
giants-bone_break_dancer.def:
At the start of each Round of Combat, choose one of the dances listed below and apply its effects until the end of the Round of Combat. The model cannot choose this dance again until after one of the following has happened:
  • The model is no longer Engaged in Combat.
  • The model has chosen a different dance.

giants-the_twist.title: The Twist
giants-the_twist.def: Enemy units in base contact do not receive any Rank Bonus to their Combat Score.

giants-giant_sentinel.title: Giant Sentinel
giants-giant_sentinel.def: The model gains Light Troops, Poison Attacks, and Sapling Bow (4+).

giants-living_bomb.title: Living Bomb
giants-living_bomb.def: When the model is removed as a casualty, all units within 6" suffer 2D6 hits with Strength 4 and Armour Penetration 1.

giants-big_sneaker.title: Big Sneaker
giants-big_sneaker.def: The model gains Multiple Wounds (2, against Large, Gigantic) and Paired Weapons . In addition, while within 6" of any other Large or Gigantic unit or any Terrain Feature other than Open Terrain, the model gains Hard Target (1).

giants-bone_chariot.title: Bone Chariot
giants-bone_chariot.def: The model part gains Harnessed, Impact Hits (D6), Swiftstride, and the model gains the following additional model parts:

giants-scarab_giant.title: Scarab Giant
giants-scarab_giant.def: The Ancient Giant model part gains Harnessed. The model gains Distracting and the following additional model part that is not affected by Undying Will:

giants-barrow_giant.title: Barrow Giant
giants-barrow_giant.def: The model gains a Halberd and Multiple Wounds (2, against Standard).

giants-ghoul_giant.title: Ghoul Giant
giants-ghoul_giant.def: The model gains Poison Attacks and Unholy Appetite.

giants-zombie_giant.title: Zombie Giant
giants-zombie_giant.def: The model gains Stubborn, its Reanimated is set to D6+1, and its Offensive Skill and Defensive Skill are set to 1. The model does not count as a model with Towering Presence for the purpose of Arise! (Hereditary Spell).

giants-legendary_beasts.title: Legendary Beasts (1)
giants-legendary_beasts.def: The sum of the <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/legendary_beasts">Legendary Beasts</nuxt-link> values stated in brackets of all models in the army is restricted to 1 per 750 Army Points, rounding fractions up.

giants-monstrous_familiar.title: Monstrous Familiar
giants-monstrous_familiar.def: The model gains Wizard Apprentice. Instead of selecting spells as normal, it must select one of the following spells (during Spell Selection): Living Steel (Alchemy), Pentagram of Pain (Occultism), or Hellfire (Hereditary Spell).

giants-tribal_warspear.title: Tribal Warspear
giants-tribal_warspear.def: Attacks with a Tribal Warspear gain +1 Strength and Multiple Wounds (D3, against Towering Presence). Charging enemy units in base contact with the wielder suffer -1 Agility. The wielder gains War Platform and Not a Leader with the following exception: it can only join units that include at least one Barbarians model.

giants-favoured_giant.title: Favoured Giant
giants-favoured_giant.def: The model loses Battle Fever and gains Trophy Rack, Hellforged Armour, Paired Weapons, and counts as a Character for the purpose of issuing, accepting, and refusing Duels.

giants-credits.def:
Cover image

Michele Bertilorenzi

Conceptual design, support, and rules

Blonde Beer, Eisenheinrich, Palmu, Scottish Knight, Skipschnit, and The Doctor
giants-credits.title: Credits

rulebook-artefacts.title: Artefacts
rulebook-artefacts.def: Unique and powerful items that can have various effects. No additional rules apply to <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/artefacts">Artefacts</nuxt-link>.

rulebook-weapon_enchantments.title: Weapon Enchantments
rulebook-weapon_enchantments.def:
Weapon Enchantments are upgrades that enhance weapons. A weapon on which a Weapon Enchantment is applied becomes an Enchanted Weapon. The Army List must indicate which weapon that the model is equipped with is an Enchanted Weapon. Reminder: all models are equipped with a Hand Weapon by default. Each Weapon Enchantment can only enchant particular weapon types (e.g. Great Weapon) or a category of weapons (e.g. Melee Weapon).

The following rules apply to all Enchanted Weapons, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  • If a model is equipped with an Enchanted Weapon it must use it in combat whenever possible.

  • All attacks made with the Enchanted Weapon gain Magical Attacks.

  • The Enchanted Weapon follows the rules for both its original weapon type and the Weapon Enchantment.

  • See the rules for weapons (Appendix I: Model Rules) for details on when to apply modifiers and additional rules.

rulebook-armour_enchantments.title: Armour Enchantments
rulebook-armour_enchantments.def:
These upgrades enchant pieces of armour carried by a model, and can in general be taken by any model. That model is then considered as wearing an Enchanted Armour.

If an Armour Enchantment is restricted to models with a minimum Arm Value, for this purpose only consider the model's part unmodified base Arm Value (excluding Mounts), the number written on the profile in the Army Book.

The following rules apply to all Armour Enchantments, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  • Characteristics modifiers, Model Rules, and all other rules associated with Armour Enchantments are generally only applied to the model part wearing the Enchanted Armour, and does not affect other model parts such as mounts. This includes modifiers to Global and Defensive Characteristics. However, note that certain Model Rules, particularly Model Rules that are neither an Attack Attribute nor a weapon, are always applied to the combined model (and not only to individual model parts).

For example the Basalt Infusion provides +1 Arm and Aegis. +1 Arm is a Characteristic modifier and is only applied to the Character wearing the Enchanted Armour. If this Character rides a mount that has its own Armour Value, the extra Arm from Basalt Infusion has no effect on the combined model. However, Aegis is a Global Model Rule, which means it is not applied to an individual model part, but to the whole combined model.

rulebook-shield_enchantments.title: Shield Enchantments
rulebook-shield_enchantments.def:
Shield Enchantments are upgrades made to Shields. An Enchanted Shield follows the rules for both the original Shield and the Shield Enchantment.

The following rules apply to all Shield Enchantments, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  • The effect of a Shield Enchantment applies only when the bearer of the Enchanted Shield actually uses the Shield (Remember that a model part cannot use a Shield to protect against Melee Attacks when it is using a Two-Handed weapon in combat).

  • Characteristic modifiers, Model Rules, and all other rules associated with Shield Enchantments follow the same rules as for Armour Enchantments.

rulebook-potions_and_scrolls.title: Potions and Scrolls
rulebook-potions_and_scrolls.def:
Potions and Scrolls are Magic Items that provide temporary effects when consumed by a model.

The following rules apply to all Potions and Scrolls, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  • All Potions and Scrolls are One Use Only.

  • Potions and Scrolls can be activated at the start of any Phase or when Choosing Equipment and Abilities in the Melee Phase.

  • Effects last until the end of the Player Turn.

  • Rules for Potions and Scrolls, including Characteristic modifiers and Attack Attributes, are only applied to the model part taking the Magic Item, and does not affect other model parts such as mounts.

rulebook-banner_enchantments.title: Banner Enchantments
rulebook-banner_enchantments.def: Banner Enchantments are upgrades for Battle Standard Bearer and units containing a Standard Bearer, assuming these units have access to Magic Items (as indicated in their unit entry).

rulebook-replicable.title: Replicable
rulebook-replicable.def: Replicable spells, can be attempted to be cast multiple times in the same Magic Phase without suffering the normal -3 modifier to the Casting Roll (or -1 in the case of Bound Spells). Note that the spell still can not be attempted multiple times by the same Wizard.

rulebook-molten_copper.title: Molten Copper
rulebook-molten_copper.def:
The target suffers D3+1 hits with Str 3, AP 3, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks.

If the target has Metal Armour, these hits are instead resolved with Str 4 and AP 4.

rulebook-corruption_of_tin.title: Corruption of Tin
rulebook-corruption_of_tin.def: The target suffers -1 Arm and gains Metal Armour.

rulebook-living_steel.title: Living Steel
rulebook-living_steel.def: The target gains +1 to hit and Magical Attacks.

rulebook-wall_of_lead.title: Wall of Lead
rulebook-wall_of_lead.def:
Place a Wall Terrain Feature with dimensions 1×6" on the target.

Remove the Terrain Feature when the spell ends.

rulebook-word_of_iron.title: Word of Iron
rulebook-word_of_iron.def: The target suffers +2 Arm and gains Metal Armour.

rulebook-quicksilver_lash.title: Quicksilver Lash
rulebook-quicksilver_lash.def:
The target suffers 2D6 hits with Str 3, AP 3, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks.

If the target has Metal Armour, these hits are instead resolved with Str 4 and AP 4.

rulebook-duality.title: Duality
rulebook-duality.def:
All Cosmology spells are divided into two versions, representing opposing aspects:
Cosmos



and Chaos


.

When casting a Cosmology spell, always declare which version of the spell you are using, and substitute the square brackets ([𝛼] or [𝛽]) with the content listed in the table at the bottom of each Spell Card corresponding to the chosen version (Cosmos or Chaos).

rulebook-weal_and_woe.title: Weal and Woe
rulebook-weal_and_woe.def:
The target must reroll [𝛼] to-wound rolls, except natural rolls of [𝛽].

[𝛼]: Failed
[𝛽]: ‘1’
[𝛼]: Successful
[𝛽]: ‘6’

rulebook-hearts_and_minds.title: Hearts and Minds
rulebook-hearts_and_minds.def:
The target [𝛼], and [𝛽] are Minimised.

[𝛼]: is considered Steady
[𝛽]: Courage Tests
[𝛼]: gains Unruly
[𝛽]: Command Tests

rulebook-truth_of_time.title: Truth of Time
rulebook-truth_of_time.def:
The target's Cha and Mob are set to [𝛼].
[𝛼]: 8"
[𝛽]: 3"

rulebook-ice_and_fire.title: Ice and Fire
rulebook-ice_and_fire.def:
The target suffers 2D6 hits with Str 4, AP 0, and Magical Attacks. Successful [𝛼] against wounds caused by this spell must be rerolled.

[𝛼]: Special Saves
[𝛽]: Armour Saves

rulebook-cosmic_scales.title: Cosmic Scales
rulebook-cosmic_scales.def:
The target gains Magical Attacks, Divine Attacks, and it's [𝛼] is set to at least 8.

[𝛼]: Def
[𝛽]: Off

rulebook-near_and_far.title: Near and Far
rulebook-near_and_far.def:
The target suffers D3+1 hits with Str 6, AP 3, and Magical Attacks.
[𝛼]: Range 24", Hex
[𝛽]: Range 6", Aura*, Universal
*The caster's unit is not targeted.

rulebook-foresight.title: Foresight
rulebook-foresight.def:
The target gains +Y Def and +X Off, where X and Y depend on the Game Turn number when the spell was cast.



  • Game Turn 1-2: +0 Def and +4 Off

  • Game Turn 3-4: +2 Def and +2 Off

  • Game Turn 5-6: +4 Def and +0 Off



No model or unit can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-fates_judgement.title: Fate's Judgement
rulebook-fates_judgement.def: The target suffers D6+X hits, where X is the Game Turn number when the spell was cast. These hits are set to wound on 4+ and are resolved with AP 0 and Magical Attacks.

rulebook-the_stars_align.title: The Stars Align
rulebook-the_stars_align.def: Target unit must reroll failed to-hit rolls.

rulebook-chance_of_redemption.title: Chance of Redemption
rulebook-chance_of_redemption.def:
The target may immediately perform a 5" Magical Move.

In addition, it gains Divine Attacks (Melee).

rulebook-inescapable_doom.title: Inescapable Doom
rulebook-inescapable_doom.def:
Immediately when the spell is cast, and at the start of each of the caster's subsequent Magic Phases, the target suffers 1 hit that wounds automatically with AP 10 and Magical Attacks.



No model or unit can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-augury_of_dispair.title: Augury of Dispair
rulebook-augury_of_dispair.def: The target suffers -3 Off, -3 Agi (to a minimum of 1), and treats all Terrain Features as Dangerous Terrain, including Open Terrain.

rulebook-fountain_of_youth.title: Fountain of Youth
rulebook-fountain_of_youth.def:
Raise 1 HP in the target's Health Pool.

No model can Raise more than 1 HP per turn from this spell.

rulebook-entwining_roots.title: Entwining Roots
rulebook-entwining_roots.def:
The target suffers -2" Cha and -2" Mob, both to a minimum of 2".

If the target or the caster is in contact with a Forest when the spell is cast:

The target suffers an additional -1" Cha and -1" Mob, both to a minimum of 2".

rulebook-healing_waters.title: Healing Waters
rulebook-healing_waters.def:
The target gains Fortitude (6+) and Fortitude (+1).


If the target or the caster is in contact with a Water Terrain when the spell is cast:

The target also gains Immune (Flaming Attacks).

rulebook-natures_venom.title: Nature's Venom
rulebook-natures_venom.def:
The target gains Poison Attacks (Melee).


If the target or the caster is in contact with a Field when the spell is cast:

The target also gains Poison Attacks (Shooting).

rulebook-stone_skin.title: Stone Skin
rulebook-stone_skin.def: The target gains +1 Res, and Melee Attacks allocated towards it never wound on better than 4+.

rulebook-earths_blessing.title: Earth's Blessing
rulebook-earths_blessing.def: Place a round Forest, Field or Water Terrain feature (declare which when casting the spell) with a 6" diameter on the target. This Terrain Feature has Dangerous Terrain. If the chosen Terrain Feature has already been created by the caster using this spell, first remove the Terrain Feature from the Battlefield before placing it again on the target.

rulebook-whispers_of_the_veil.title: Whispers of the Veil
rulebook-whispers_of_the_veil.def:
The target suffers -1 Res.



No model or unit can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-touch_of_the_reaper.title: Touch of the Reaper
rulebook-touch_of_the_reaper.def:
The target suffers D3 hits with Str 9, AP 10, and Magical Attacks.

When rolling to wound with this attack, substitute the target's Res with its Cou.

rulebook-danse_macabre.title: Danse Macabre
rulebook-danse_macabre.def:
The target may immediately perform a 4" Magical Move.

In addition, it gains Dying Blow, Ghost Step.

rulebook-spectral_blades.title: Spectral Blades
rulebook-spectral_blades.def: Standard Melee Attacks from Rank-and-File models in the target have their Str always set to 4, AP always set to 4, and gain Magical Attacks.

rulebook-soul_blight.title: Soul Blight
rulebook-soul_blight.def:
The target takes a Courage Test:


  • If passed it suffers D6 hits.

  • If failed it suffers 2D6 hits.


Hits are with Str 9, AP 10, and Magical Attacks.

When rolling to wound with this attack, substitute the target's Res with its Cou.

rulebook-the_sacrifice.title: The Sacrifice
rulebook-the_sacrifice.def: Before casting certain spells (marked on the spell itself), you may choose a friendly unit within 12" of the caster to immediately suffer from The Devouring Dark. If The Sacrifice was performed, the Range of the spell is increased by +6".

rulebook-the_devouring_dark.title: The Devouring Dark
rulebook-the_devouring_dark.def:
The target suffers a hit with Area Attack (2×2), Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks.

No model or unit can be affected by more than one instance of this spell during the same Magic Phase, including The Sacrifice.

rulebook-hand_of_glory.title: Hand of Glory
rulebook-hand_of_glory.def:
The target gains Aegis (6+) and Aegis (+1, max. 3+).



The Sacrifice may be performed for this spell.

rulebook-blood_curse.title: Blood Curse
rulebook-blood_curse.def:
The target suffers -1 Str and -1 AP.



The Sacrifice may be performed for this spell.

rulebook-pentagram_of_pain.title: Pentagram of Pain
rulebook-pentagram_of_pain.def: The target suffers 3 hits, with Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks. If one ore more unsaved wounds are caused with this spell, the Caster of the spell Recovers 1 HP.

rulebook-the_grave_calls.title: The Grave Calls
rulebook-the_grave_calls.def:
The target suffers 8 hits, with Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks.



The Sacrifice may be performed for this spell.

rulebook-umbral_majesty.title: Umbral Majesty
rulebook-umbral_majesty.def:
The target gains Dying Blow, and a single model part in the target gains Grind Attack (4, Str 5, AP 2, Magical Attacks).

Wherever possible, enemy models must allocate their Melee Attacks towards a Health Pool that is not the target.

rulebook-fireball.title: Fireball
rulebook-fireball.def:
The target suffers 2D3
hits with Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks
.

rulebook-flaming_swords.title: Flaming Swords
rulebook-flaming_swords.def: The target gains +1 to wound, <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/magical_attacks">Magical Attacks</nuxt-link>, <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/flaming_attacks">Flaming Attacks</nuxt-link>.

rulebook-dragons_roar.title: Dragon's Roar
rulebook-dragons_roar.def:
A single model part in the target gains Breath Attack (Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks), and

Grind Attack (2D6, Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks).

rulebook-pyroclastic_flow.title: Pyroclastic Flow
rulebook-pyroclastic_flow.def:
The target suffers 5D3
hits with Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks
.

rulebook-pillars_of_fire.title: Pillars of Fire
rulebook-pillars_of_fire.def: Standard Melee Attacks from Rank-and-File models in the target hit automatically, have their Str always set to 4, AP always set to 0, and gain Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks.

rulebook-cage_of_embers.title: Cage of Embers
rulebook-cage_of_embers.def:
Immediately when the spell is cast, and whenever the target moves, it suffers 2D3
hits with Str 4, AP 0, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks
. If this damage causes the target to suffer at least one HP loss, it gains Weakness (Flaming Attacks).

rulebook-predators_instinct.title: Predator's Instinct
rulebook-predators_instinct.def:
The target gains +2" Cha and Resistance (Ranged Attacks).



No model or unit can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-awaken_the_beast.title: Awaken the Beast
rulebook-awaken_the_beast.def: The target gains +1 Str and +1 AP.

rulebook-swarm_of_insects.title: Swarm of Insects
rulebook-swarm_of_insects.def:
The target suffers 5D6 hits with AP 0 and Magical Attacks. These hits always wound on 6+.

In addition, it suffers -1 to hit with Shooting Attacks.

rulebook-savage_fury.title: Savage Fury
rulebook-savage_fury.def: The target gains <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/fury">Fury</nuxt-link>, <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/fearless">Fearless</nuxt-link>, <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/frenzy">Frenzy</nuxt-link>.

rulebook-totemic_summon.title: Totemic Summon
rulebook-totemic_summon.def: Summon a Totemic Beast (profile below), that is immediately placed on the Battlefield using the rules for Ambush (Board Edge).

rulebook-wild_shape.title: Wild Shape
rulebook-wild_shape.def: The target's Height is increased by +1, to a maximum of 5, and it gains +1 Res and Stomp Attacks (1). If it already had Stomp Attacks, the number of hits caused by its Stomp Attacks is increased by +1. In models with multiple model parts, only a single model part, chosen by the caster, is affected.

rulebook-divine_intervention.title: Divine Intervention
rulebook-divine_intervention.def:
When resolving the effects of a Thaumaturgy spell, roll a D6:


  • On a ‘5’ or ‘6’: Apply the Blessing effects, marked with a .

  • On a ‘1’: Apply the Admonition effects, marked with a .

rulebook-smite_the_unbeliever.title: Smite the Unbeliever
rulebook-smite_the_unbeliever.def:
The target suffers D6 hits with Str 4, AP 2, and Magical Attacks.


  • : These hits are instead resolved with Str 6.

  • : These hits are instead resolved with Str 2.

rulebook-light_of_faith.title: Light of Faith
rulebook-light_of_faith.def:
The target gains Fearless, Stubborn.


  • : The target is considered to have one additional Proper Rank*.

  • : The target is considered to have one less Proper Rank*.


*For Steady, Steadfast, Surrounded and Rank Bonus purposes.

rulebook-weight_of_judgement.title: Weight of Judgement
rulebook-weight_of_judgement.def:
The target's Agi is set to 1.


  • : Enemy* units in the same combat as the target has their Agi set to 1.

  • : Friendly* units in the same combat as the target has their Agi set to 1.


*From the perspective of the caster.

At the time of casting the spell.

rulebook-holy_affliction.title: Holy Affliction
rulebook-holy_affliction.def:
The target suffers -1 to wound.


  • : The target suffers -1 AP.

  • : The target gains +1 AP.

rulebook-rain_of_fire.title: Rain of Fire
rulebook-rain_of_fire.def:
The target suffers D3 hits with Str 8, AP 4, Magical Attacks, Flaming Attacks.


  • : The caster picks an additional target.

  • : The opponent picks an additional target.


67.2

rulebook-wrath_of_god.title: Wrath of God
rulebook-wrath_of_god.def:
Place a marker on the target point. Instead of rolling for Divine Intervention when the spell is cast, do it at the start of each subsequent Magic Phase.


  • : Each unit within 2D6" from the center of the marker suffers 2D6 with Str 5, AP 2, and Magical Attacks. Then remove the marker.

  • : The opponent may move the marker in any direction up to 3".

rulebook-evil_eye.title: Evil Eye
rulebook-evil_eye.def:
The target suffers -1 Cou and loses Devastating Charge and/or First Strike (if it has them). If the target rolls for the number of Impact Hits, this roll is Minimised.



No model or unit can be affected by more than one instance of this spell simultaneously.

rulebook-soured_luck.title: Soured Luck
rulebook-soured_luck.def: Melee Attacks against the target are set to hit on 3+.

rulebook-illusory_paths.title: Illusory Paths
rulebook-illusory_paths.def:
Choose which effect to apply when casting the spell:


  • The target gains Random Movement (2D6").

  • The target gains Random Movement (3D6").

rulebook-cauldrons_curse.title: Cauldron's Curse
rulebook-cauldrons_curse.def: The target gains Weakness (Ranged Attacks).

rulebook-mists_of_invisibility.title: Mists of Invisibility
rulebook-mists_of_invisibility.def: Mark the ground under the center of the target. The target gains Ambush (within 12" of the marked point). Then remove the target from the Battlefield. It automatically passes the roll to return to the Battlefield in your next Player Turn.

rulebook-clouded_sight.title: Clouded Sight
rulebook-clouded_sight.def: The target cannot draw <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/line_of_sight">Line of Sight</nuxt-link> to a target more than 12" from it.

rulebook-infantry.title: Infantry
rulebook-infantry.def: <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/infantry">Infantry</nuxt-link> does not grant additional <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/model">Model</nuxt-link> Rules

rulebook-cavalry.title: Cavalry
rulebook-cavalry.def: The <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/model">model</nuxt-link> has Cannot be Stomped, <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/swiftstride">Swiftstride</nuxt-link> and Tall

rulebook-construct.title: Construct
rulebook-construct.def: The <nuxt-link class="ruleLink" to="/app/rule/model">model</nuxt-link> cannot use  and has Chariot

rulebook-ambush.title: Ambush
rulebook-ambush.def:
Units with Ambush may choose to not be deployed normally, by simply not placing it on the Battlefield during Deployment. If so, the unit will arrive at the Battlefield at a later point during the game. From your Player Turn 2 and onwards, roll a D6 for each Ambushing unit at the start of the Movement Phase. Units that roll 3+ will enter the Battlefield. During your Player Turn 5 and 6, this roll is always considered to have rolled a 3+.

When a unit arrives, pick a point on the Battlefield as specified by (X) if no suitable spot is available, the unit can’t enter the Battlefield this turn. If the roll is failed, roll again to see if it arrives in the next friendly Player Turn.

  • Place the unit fully within 6" from the chosen point. There must be no other units or Impassable Terrain directly between any point on the unit’s Boundary and the chosen point. See the figure below for examples.

  • Ambushing units count as having performed an Advance Move when they arrive, and thus cannot perform Move Manoeuvres in the same Phase.


  • If an Ambushing unit doesn’t enter the Battlefield by the end of the game, it’s considered Destroyed.

  • An Attachable Model with Ambush can arrive at the Battlefield together with an Ambushing unit it can join. Declare this before rolling to see if the unit arrives, and make a single dice roll for the Combined Unit.

image
Figure 14: Deploying Ambushing units
In these examples, the unit has Ambush (Table Edge). The unit with the yellow check mark is placed in a legal position, while the two units with red crosses are not. The left one because there is an Impassable Terrain Feature between its unit Boundary and the chosen point, and the right one because parts of the unit are more than 6" away from the chosen point.

rulebook-attached.title: Attached
rulebook-attached.def: This model must be deployed inside a unit containing Rank-and-File models, and it cannot voluntarily leave its unit.

rulebook-bodyguard.title: Bodyguard
rulebook-bodyguard.def:
While a Character is joined to a unit containing Bodyguard, that Character gains Stubborn. Furthermore, a Character in a unit containing Bodyguard is not limited to Restricted Attacks when not accepting a Duel.

When Characters or Character types are stated in brackets, Bodyguard only works for the specified Characters or Character types.

rulebook-captain.title: Captain
rulebook-captain.def:
